00012   DetectorHistory::DetectorHistory(Detector* d,int* ct,int max, int m_a_i) : 
00013     detector(d), current_time(ct), max_history(max), max_activations_interval(m_a_i), max_activations(0), active(false) {
00014     history.push_back(-1);

00020   void DetectorHistory::setInitialState(){

00064   void DetectorHistory::activate(double time){
00065     // If the activation is the last thing on the history
00066     if(insertTimeInHistory(time)){
00067       last_activation_time = time;
00068       active = true;
00069     }
00070   }
00071 
00072 
00077   void DetectorHistory::deactivate(double time){
00078     // If the deactivation is the last thing on the history
00079     if(insertTimeInHistory(time)){
00080       last_deactivation_time = time;
00081       active = false;
00082     }
00083   }
00084   
00090   bool DetectorHistory::insertTimeInHistory(double time){
00091     // Looking for the insertion position
00092     vector<double>::iterator pos = history.end();
00093     for(vector<double>::iterator el = history.begin(); el != history.end(); el++){
00094       if( *el > time - EPS){
00095         pos = el;
00096         break;
00097       }
00098     }
00099     bool ok = false;
00100     // If it's the end of the history :-)
00101     if(pos == history.end()){
00102       ok = true;
00103     }
00104     //Inserting
00105     history.insert(pos,time);
00106     
00107     //Refreshing max activations
00108     double start = time - max_activations_interval;
00109     start = start < 0 ? 0 : start;
00110     int new_total = totalActivations(start,time);
00111     if(max_activations < new_total){
00112       max_activations = new_total;
00113     }
00114 
00115     //Keeping history constrained (Or do you have unlimited memory? :-)
00116     //As erase is an expensive operation, we wait until we double the limit
00117     int hist_size = history.size();
00118     if(hist_size > 2*max_history){
00119       int keep_parity = (max_history % 2 == 1 && hist_size % 2 == 1) ? 1 : 0;
00120       history.erase(history.begin(),history.begin()+max_history+keep_parity);
00121       assert((int)history.size() % 2 == hist_size % 2); // parity kept?
00122     }
00123 
00124     return ok;
00125   }
00126 
00131   int DetectorHistory::totalActivations(double start){
00132     return totalActivations(start, (double)*current_time);
00133   }
00134 
00140   int DetectorHistory::totalActivations(double start, double end){
00141 
00142     bool active = false; // Tells if it's currently active in the history
00143 
00144     int total = 0;
00145     for(vector<double>::iterator el = history.begin(); el != history.end(); el++){
00146       double action_time = *el;
00147       
00148       // For every activation inside the interval
00149       if(active && action_time >= start - EPS &&  action_time <= end + EPS ) total++;
00150 
00151       // Not using the 2 lines below... or It will keep counting cars stoped at the signal as throughput
00152       // If deactivating, have never activated and not the first deactivation, then was active somewhere inside the interval
00153       // if(!active && total == 0 && action_time > EPS && action_time >= start - EPS ) total++;
00154 
00155       if(action_time >= end - EPS) break;
00156 
00157       active =! active; // Inverting
00158     }
00159 
00160     return total;
00161   }  
00162 
00167   int DetectorHistory::totalDeactivations(double start){
00168     return totalDeactivations(start, (double)*current_time);
00169   }
00170 
00176   int DetectorHistory::totalDeactivations(double start, double end){
00177 
00178     bool active = false; // Tells if it's currently active in the history
00179 
00180     int total = 0;
00181     for(vector<double>::iterator el = history.begin(); el != history.end(); el++){
00182       double action_time = *el;
00183       
00184       // For every activation inside the interval
00185       if(!active && action_time >= start - EPS &&  action_time <= end + EPS ) total++;
00186 
00187       // Not using the 2 lines below... or It will keep counting cars stoped at the signal as throughput
00188       // If deactivating, have never activated and not the first deactivation, then was active somewhere inside the interval
00189       // if(!active && total == 0 && action_time > EPS && action_time >= start - EPS ) total++;
00190 
00191       if(action_time >= end - EPS) break;
00192 
00193       active =! active; // Inverting
00194     }
00195 
00196     return total;
00197   }
